alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 22 at 4:21PM PDT until April 26 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Monitoring Stage. Some very minor flooding occurs at scattered locations along the reach. No flooding occurs in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet Monday morning. It is forecast to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Humboldt River Comus 9.5 8.6 Sat 4 pm PDT 9.3 9.5 9.5 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1045 AM PDT.
